sentences.english: The young boxer has copped the prize of the first round.
sentences.chinese: 這位年輕的拳擊手已獲得了第一回合的勝利。

sentences.english: Boxing is about respect - getting it for yourself and taking it away from the other guy.
sentences.chinese: 拳擊是關於尊嚴，贏得你自己的，同時也剝奪別人的。

sentences.english: Most boxers can fight only five rounds because this kind of fighting is very difficult.
sentences.chinese: 大多數拳擊手只能打五輪，因爲這種拼鬥非常困難。

sentences.english: PUGILISTS and aesthetes are not necessarily in opposing corners.
sentences.chinese: 拳擊家和美學家未必就湊不到一塊兒。

sentences.english: The challenger showed the white feather as soon as he stepped into the ring with the champion.
sentences.chinese: 這位挑戰者同冠軍一踏進拳擊場時就膽怯了。

sentences.english: Ali was the cock of the walk for many years in boxing circles .
sentences.chinese: 阿里在拳擊圈裏當了好幾年的頭號人物。

sentences.english: She also practices boxing, planting vegetables on her roof garden, and cooks all by herself.
sentences.chinese: 她還練習拳擊，在屋頂花園種蔬菜，自己做飯。

sentences.english: The boxer feinted with his right hand and struck with his left hand.
sentences.chinese: 這個拳擊手用右手佯攻而出左手擊打。

sentences.english: Because of this,they were known as'prizefighters.'
sentences.chinese: 因此，他們被稱作“博獎拳擊手”。

sentences.english: Yang Sigeng is a boxer indeed!
Kim was carried out of the ring by stretcher and rushed to Desert Springs Hospital.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，金被擔架擡出拳擊臺，送往沙漠甘泉醫院。

sentences.english: She is a regular boxer in petticoats.
sentences.chinese: 她是個十足的巾幗拳擊家。

sentences.english: The heavyweight danced around the ring like a lightweight.
sentences.chinese: 重量級選手像輕量級選手一樣在拳擊場上跳躍。

sentences.english: "Oh, no, " she said breathlessly. "No, I wouldn't like fights.
sentences.chinese: “不，”她緩和地說，“我可不愛好拳擊賽。

sentences.english: At the end of the story, the protagonist emerges as a powerful pugilist.
sentences.chinese: 在故事的結尾，主角變成了一個強有力的拳擊家。

sentences.english: Tony was an experienced boxer and he was known for leading with his left hand.
sentences.chinese: 託尼是一個有經驗的拳擊家，他以左手出拳而聞名。

definition: to fight, esp. with hands/wrestling (as a sport)/to wrestle/to wrestle (against fate, with a problem etc)/to capture prey
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
